sentences.english: The musician can discriminate minute variations in tone.
sentences.chinese: 樂師能辨別聲調的各種細微變化。

sentences.english: Bandits, Aproaching the musicians' in the village.
As the musicians struck up, the wicker husband and the ugly girl went to dance.
sentences.chinese: 樂師們在演奏，柳條丈夫和醜女孩翩翩起舞。

sentences.english: Babies and the chancy life of a musician do not exactly go together.
sentences.chinese: 生兒育女和樂師動盪不定的生活是不合拍的。

sentences.english: "The musicians will sit in their gallery, " said the young Student.
sentences.chinese: “樂師們會坐在他們的廊廳中，”年輕的學生說。

sentences.english: All the musicians who were chosen to play in the court were treated royally .
sentences.chinese: 而那些被挑選入宮的樂師，受到了特別優厚的待遇。

sentences.english: Warrington was curious, and not ill pleased at the musician's taunts and irascibility.
sentences.chinese: 沃林頓有些驚訝，但沒有計較樂師的奚落和憤怒。
交響樂樂師未必就能視奏。

sentences.english: Afterward, he once had held the post of the Lucar palace musician.
sentences.chinese: 後來，他曾擔任過盧卡宮廷樂師。

sentences.english: And then there is the sheer joy, etched so openly on the musicians' faces.
sentences.chinese: 樂師們臉上有種表露無遺的純粹快樂。

sentences.english: The musicians took their respective places at the orchestra pit.
sentences.chinese: 樂師們各自在樂池就座。

sentences.english: At 25 he was an unemployed musician with no prospects.
sentences.chinese: 25歲的他是個沒有工作，前途渺茫的樂師。

sentences.english: The Queen Bestowed the title of the Queen's Music upon the young musician.
sentences.chinese: 女王把皇家音樂大師的稱號授予那位年輕的樂師。

sentences.english: Even outstanding musicians require constant practice.
sentences.chinese: 既使是好樂師也需經常練習。

sentences.english: At a symphony concert the musicians play their instruments under the direction of a conductor.
sentences.chinese: 交響音樂會的樂師們按照指揮的指令演奏樂器。

definition: Minyue county in Zhangye 張掖|张掖[Zhang1 ye4], Gansu
folk music, esp. for traditional instruments
to perform music/to play a tune
ballad tune in southern dialects, usually to sanxian 三弦 or pipa 琵琶 accompaniment
